Adding a domain configuration

To configure the domain configuration, perform the following:

 1. In the Authentication screen, enter the required fields.

Field Name

Description

Name

The name of the domain.

The field entry can have alphanumeric, underscore and hyphen. You can not change this name after the object has been saved.

Realm

The authentication protocol must be applied to users in this domain. Select any one of the authentication protocol to assign in the Cisco UCS ADA domain, depending on your requirement.

 • Local

 • LDAP

 • Radius

 • Tacacs

Refresh Period (sec)

The refresh time period enables the web session to be active, and thereby indicates the time interval of refresh requests in the Cisco UCS ADA domain.

The time must be defined in secs between 60 and 172800. The default time period is 60 secs.

Provider Group

The configured authentication provider is defined for your Cisco UCS ADA domain. Specify provider(s) depending on your requirement.

 • If the authentication protocol is set to Local in Realm field, then there is no need for any authentication provider to be added.

 • Ensure that the session timeout period is greater than the refresh timeout period.

For more information, see Provider Groups.

Session Timeout (sec)

This defines the time limit for the web session to be terminated beyond the refresh request time period.

The time must be defined in secs between 60 and 172800. The default time period is 7200 secs.

Two factor Authentication

The selection indicates that multiple authentication provider(s) can be used in the Cisco UCS ADA domain.

 2. Click Add/Edit Provider Groups next to Provider Group to add an authentication provider for a user domain. See Creating a Provider Groups

 3. Click Add Domain to add the domain.

The domain details is displayed in the Domain Configuration text area.
